security_audit.summary: This is a minimal documentation-only template skill with no executable code. All 17 static analysis findings are false positives caused by the scanner detecting patterns in metadata and documentation strings rather than actual security risks. The skill contains only SKILL.md (7 lines of YAML with placeholder text) and skill-report.json (the analysis report). No network calls, crypto operations, C2 indicators, or malicious code exists.

best_practices: Use clear, specific instructions that define exactly when Claude should activate the skill
Include realistic usage examples that demonstrate the skill in action
Document limitations and edge cases to set proper user expectations
anti_patterns: Leaving template placeholder text in published skills
Adding overly complex functionality without clear documentation
Skipping version numbers or author information in the metadata

faq.question: Is this a working skill or just a template?
faq.answer: This is a starter template. It contains no functional code and serves as a foundation for building custom skills.

faq.question: What files should I add to make this skill functional?
faq.answer: Add executable scripts, code files, or detailed prompt instructions in SKILL.md based on what you want the skill to accomplish.

faq.question: Can I publish skills based on this template?
faq.answer: Yes. Customize the template with your own functionality, documentation, and metadata before submitting to the marketplace.

faq.question: Does this template access my files or system?
faq.answer: No. The template itself contains no executable code. Any file or system access depends on code you add later.

faq.question: What category should I assign to my custom skill?
faq.answer: Choose from: coding, devops, writing, documentation, productivity, office, data, research, communication, design, security, or legal.

faq.question: How is this different from other skills in the marketplace?
faq.answer: This is intentionally minimal. Other skills contain pre-built functionality. This is for developers building their own skills from scratch.
